intro: Selliguea kachinensis, commonly known as the Kachin moss, is a species of liverwort found in the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form. The plant has a dark green to reddish-brown thallus with a smooth surface and is often found on rocky substrates. It is adapted to humid, shaded environments and exhibits asexual reproduction through gemmae. Selliguea kachinensis plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
